alert.note: Alert for Grant; Jackson; Natchitoches; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 11:53PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GRANT...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON...SOUTHEASTERN NATCHITOCHES AND WINN PARISHES THROUGH 1230 AM CST... At 1152 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles northwest of Clarks to 10 miles south of Winnfield to 7 miles northeast of Kurthwood. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winnfield, Colfax, Montgomery, Dodson, Georgetown, Atlanta, Sikes, Kisatchie, Cloutierville, Melrose, Hudson, Bellwood, Chopin, Rochelle, Joyce, Lake Iatt, Aloha, Williana, and Gorum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
